semantic_identifier: Impact--Add data sufficiency diagnostics (sample size + coverage) to fit score output.docx

hierarchy.file_name: Impact--Add data sufficiency diagnostics (sample size + coverage) to fit score output.docx

sections.text:
This feature adds “data sufficiency” diagnostics to the fit score output so customers can understand when a score may be less reliable due to limited underlying data. Today, fit scores can look equally confident even when they’re generated from sparse or stale inputs, which increases the risk of misinterpretation and reduces trust when results don’t match expectations.

On the backend, we will compute and return diagnostics per segment used in fit score generation: sample size, recency of the underlying data, and coverage of key signals (e.g., which required/important inputs were present vs. missing). These diagnostics will be attached to the existing fit score response contract, enabling the UI to present a clear “limited data” warning and optionally expose the contributing reasons (e.g., “low sample size” or “missing key signals”) without requiring additional calls.

We will introduce configurable thresholds (by environment and/or tenant as needed) that determine when a segment is considered low-data and should trigger a warning. This allows product and data teams to tune sensitivity as we learn, and provides a consistent, explainable standard for when we flag results rather than relying on ad hoc interpretation.

Finally, we will add basic logging to quantify how often fit scores are produced under low-data conditions and which diagnostic dimensions are most commonly failing. This instrumentation helps us monitor rollout impact, identify segments where we should improve data collection or modeling strategy, and measure whether warnings reduce downstream confusion and support load over time.
